channel.title: An error while trying to add the Players Online in quest tab
channel.description:
Ok heres the error:
textHandler.java:5: cannot find symbol symbol : variable logincount location: class client if (c.logincount = true) { ^ 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .
Can anyone help out im only a nooby coder :(

item.title: An error while trying to add the Players Online in quest tab
item.dc:creator: @Verticol Verticol
item.description:
@Verticol wrote:

Ah it now shows on quest tab but wont update unless we logg out and in… help :S

Read full topic

item.title: An error while trying to add the Players Online in quest tab
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.source: An error while trying to add the Players Online in quest tab

item.title: An error while trying to add the Players Online in quest tab
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:3, topic:360473”][quote author=usman555 link=topic=456788.msg3343331#msg3343331 date=1284594373]
im guessing you didnt declare the boolean “logincount”
so declare it… and also its not = true, its == true.
[/quote]
Not true.

public static void main(String[] args) { boolean bool = true; if (bool = true) System.out.println("True"); else System.out.println("False"); if (bool == true) System.out.println("True"); else System.out.println("False"); if (bool) System.out.println("True"); else System.out.println("False"); }

Guess what it prints out

True True True[/quote]
He is right. Try this one then.

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        boolean bool = false;
        if (bool = true) {
            System.out.println("True");
        } else {
            System.out.println("False");
        }
        if (bool == true) {
            System.out.println("True");
        } else {
            System.out.println("False");
        }
        if (bool) {
            System.out.println("True");
        } else {
            System.out.println("False");
        }
    }

Guess what the output is?

True
True
True…

if (bool = true) {

You do not check if bool is true, but instead you assign is as true. This line;

System.out.println("True");

is always executed.

Read full topic
item.source: An error while trying to add the Players Online in quest tab

item.title: An error while trying to add the Players Online in quest tab

@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:2, topic:360473”]im guessing you didnt declare the boolean “logincount”
so declare it… and also its not = true, its == true.[/quote]
Not true.

public static void main(String[] args) { boolean bool = true; if (bool = true) System.out.println("True"); else System.out.println("False"); if (bool == true) System.out.println("True"); else System.out.println("False"); if (bool) System.out.println("True"); else System.out.println("False"); }

Guess what it prints out

True True True
